channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘So much for holiday cheer’: I saw a guest take a bottle of wine as they left a Christmas party. Do I tell the host?
item.description: “I guess he thought no one would notice. It came in a gift bag, and it looked expensive.”

item.title: ‘You need a third job or a rich husband’: I fell victim to Allen Stanford’s multibillion-dollar Ponzi scheme and survived
item.description: “If you have never found yourself in a situation where your life does a complete 180, it’s wrong to talk down to anyone.”

item.title: ‘I would like to give her a head start in life’: My house rose in value by $500K. Do I gift it to my daughter at a bargain price?
item.description: “I would sell it to her for enough to allow me to pay cash for a much smaller condo.”

item.title: Move over, Mariah: Michael Bublé is becoming the king of Christmas music with nearly $16 million in holiday earnings
item.description: “Bublé has been a busy little elf,” music-industry experts note

item.title: ‘I’m terrified I’ll be homeless when my husband, 76, stops working’: We only have $100K. What happens to people like us?
item.description: “I’m sick of reading how many millions everyone has.”

item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
